page.title: 14THATCHER'S WOOD
page.content:
{Thatcher's wood }covers 76 acres. It is dense woodland and stretches for a long way on both banks of Marl Brook. The owners are keen to preserve some rare species of plants, and they do not welcome too many visitors.There are many{tracks}going through the wood, which is mainly made up of trees that are less than about 50 years old.
The{undergrowth}is very dense, and twining, twisting{creepers}prevent entry in many parts. There are some hoof prints left by small groups of horse-riders.
A short way above the wood, new coniferous saplings have been planted.
# # # # # # # # # # # # # # #
